metadata.title: CVE-2016-6610 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
A full path disclosure vulnerability was discovered in phpMyAdmin where auser can trigger a particular error in the export mechanism to discover thefull path of phpMyAdmin on the disk. All 4.6.x versions (prior to 4.6.4),4.4.x versions (prior to 4.4.15.8), and 4.0.x versions (prior to 4.0.10.17)are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6610` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.4+dfsg1-1').
